Craig - Bolivia´s new constitution is based on "Atonomia" (from dictatorship and corruption). Everyone wants it, but Santa Cruz tried to use it to become totally seperate from the Bolivian Government (that didn´t succeed. Now Santa Cruz is one of 9 "Departments" of Bolivia (kind of like our States, but State here refers to the Government). 298 areas have been granted "Total Atonomia", like our Indian Reservations (Territorio Indñigena Originario Campesino - TICO). This seems to be working out ok for them, but everyone else are up in the air (with little if any change that improves their lives (Vivir Bien). So what kind of government would you reccomend if you had a fresh slate to work with?

Awww, you skipped the Senate Office of the Legislative Council and the House Office of same. They're the people in charge of actually turning ideas into legalese (if a rep chooses not to use their own staffers or a lobbyist's bill). They serve an important function but try to fly under the radar. Personally, I'm glad they exist because they answer the important question of how Congress can do the function of writing laws despite not being full of people trained in doing so.
